Key Match Events: Cole Ragans struck out 10 in a row in the sixth inning
Bobby Witt Jr. hit a walk-off single in the sixth inning but Ben Gamel made a diving play to prevent it
Jose Altuve was hit by a pitch, leading to two unearned runs for the Astros
Jeremy Pe√±a tripled to give the Astros a four-run lead in the sixth inning
Steven Cruz pitched two perfect innings
Garrett Hampson made a leaping catch to rob Yordan Alvarez of a home run in the ninth inning
Bobby Witt Jr. hit a home run in the eighth inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Royals managed to win the tiebreaker against the Astros, which could still matter if the Royals can find a way to win the division
The Royals still haven't lost five in a row all year
The Royals will have reinforcements tomorrow, with Tommy Pham, Robbie Grossman, and Yuli Gurriel expected to join the lineup
Post-Match Reflections: The Royals still hold the second Wild Card spot, four games clear of a playoff spot, a game clear of the Twins, and only three games back of the Guardians for the division lead
The Royals' Magic Number shrank to 22
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game started at 1:10 central time
Alec Marsh will return to the Royals and make the start
Ronel Blanco will go for the Astros
